text: Write code as if it were accompanied by a violent psychopath who knows where you live
author: Steve McConnell

text: Program complexity grows until it exceeds the programmer's ability
author: Arthur Bloch. Murphy's Laws

text: Programming today is a race of software developers striving to write programs with more and better idiot resistance, and the universe trying to create more select idiots. As long as the universe wins.
author: Rick Cook

text: Walking on water and developing software following the ToR is very easy... if it's frozen
author: I. Berard

text: C programming is like fast dancing on a freshly polished floor of people with sharp razors in their hands.
author: Waldi Ravens

text: Don't worry if something doesn't work. If everything worked, you'd be fired.
author: Mosher's Law of Software Engineering

text: To write clean code, we first write dirty code and then refactor it.
author: Robert Martin

text: Sometimes it's better to stay home on Monday than to spend the whole week debugging code written on Monday.
author: Christopher Thompson

text: We're seeing a society that is increasingly dependent on machines, but uses them more and more inefficiently.
author: Douglas Rushkoff

text: Programming is about breaking something big and impossible into something small and quite real.
author: jazzwant

text: Does it work? Don't touch it.
author: Any programmer

text: People think security is a noun, something you can buy. In reality, security is an abstract concept, like happiness.
author: James Gosling

text: I think this will be a new feature. Just don't tell anyone that it came about by accident.
author: Larry Wall

text: Laziness is the main virtue of a programmer.
author: Larry Wall

text: It's easier to invent the future than predict it.
author: Alan Kay

text: Magic ceases to exist once you understand how it works.
author: Tim Berners-Lee

text: Measuring a programmer's productivity by counting lines of code is like judging an aircraft's build by its weight.
author: Bill Gates
